suggestion: You can try jumping rope for a great indoor cardio exercise. Even without a real rope, it can get your heart working.
For a high intensity indoor cardio option, burpees engage your entire body from head to toe. Give them a try!
For a high intensity indoor cardio option, jumping jacks engage your entire body from head to toe. Give them a try!
Getting in your daily exercise doesn't have to be a chore. Spending a few minutes dancing to music can be a great indoor cardio activity.
If you have some stairs in your home, a stair climb is a great indoor cardio activity!
You can try swimming at an ourdoor pool for a great aerobic workout.
A pair of rollerblades are great for getting cardio workouts outdoors with a bit more excitement than a simple jog!
Push-ups are a classic strength training technique and super easy to do at home. Even just a few reps can add up over time!
Step-ups are an easy strength training techinque to try at home. Adding weights in your hands makes this even more effective!
For some outdoor strength training, find a fallen log or curb to balance on for a tightrope walk!
If you're training outside, find a bench and use it to try some inclined push-ups to work a different set of mucsles!
If you're training outside, find a bench and try some dips! Face away from the bench and use your arms to lower and raise the rest of your body.
Portobello Chicken Cutlets with Broccoli: Adding nutty Gruyère atop the chicken at the very end and popping it under the broiler makes this dish delicious!
Lemon-Garlic Steak & Green Beans: For a steak that's deliciously tender, flavorful and not too fatty, we reach for strip (also known as New York strip or shell steak).
Chicken & Cauliflower-Rice Casserole: Get your veggies and your protein fix in this easy casserole. Riced cauliflower stands in for traditional rice, super low in carbs!
Crustless Broccoli-Cheddar Quiche: This simple quiche is as easy to make as it is delicious! The egg mixture gets poured directly into the pie pan.
Frittata with Asparagus, Leek & Ricotta: Serve this spring-vegetable  frittata with an arugula salad and a hunk of crusty bread. Tip: This cooks quickly!
Roasted Salmon & Asparagus with Sauce Gribiche: Gribiche is a classic French sauce made with pantry items including Dijon mustard, parsley and hard-boiled eggs.
Chicken Broth with Pho:  This chicken alternative with noodles is insanely delicious and easy to make!
Blackened Chicken: Just toss the pan in the over before cooking on the stovetop for an easy, delicious meal.
Slow Cooker Turkey Breast: All you need to do is mix up a simple brown sugar rub, coat the meat, and let your slow cooker do the rest!
Air Fryer Fish: An  air fryer fish is the perfect substitute to traditional frying. Skipping the frying means no unnecessary oil and it takes less time!
Grilled Balsamic Mushrooms: Mushrooms are often viewed as a lame side dish for vegetarians, but when tossed in an amazing glaze, they're for everyone!
Chicken and Sweet Potato Curry: A creamy dish that's low on fats, smells amazing and is a fantastic comfort food dish!
